page.title: 16Lundy and the National Trust
page.content: Lundy came onto the market in 1968.The National Trust were interested but needed to raise Â£100,000.Three Devon M.P's,Jeremy Thorpe,Peter Mills and David Owen,led the campaign to save Lundy for the nation.It was the generosity of Jack Hayward,a British millionaire living in the Bahamas, who made the purchase possible.He had previously enabled the rescue of Brunel's S.S Great Britain and now gave Â£150,000 to the National Trust so that the purchase could proceed.An appeal by the Devon M.P.s raised a further Â£100,000 to help towards repairs.The Landmark Trust agreed to administer the island and were granted a 60 year lease.A programme of restoration and improvement is now well under way and the future of the island and its unique heritage seems assured.
